headline: Dow Hovers Near Breakeven. Most of the Market Is Struggling.
summary: The Dow was positive in Tuesday afternoon trading after a round-trip from a 100-point gain to a 100-point decline.  The blue-chip index was moving in and out of positive territory with 16 of its 30 stocks on the rise.  UnitedHealth Group, 3M, Amazon.com, Home Depot, and Boeing were among its biggest contributors.

raw.headline: Dow Hovers Near Breakeven. Most of the Market Is Struggling.

headline: The Dow Is Back to Breakeven. Most of the Market Is Struggling.
summary: The Dow was flat in Tuesday afternoon trading after a round-trip from a 100-point gain to a 100-point decline.  The blue-chip index was moving in and out of positive territory with 13 of its 30 stocks on the rise.  UnitedHealth Group, 3M, Amazon.com, Home Depot, and Boeing were among its biggest contributors.

headline: Next Level Aviation® Completes Recap of Turning Rock Partners
summary: Next Level Aviation® (NLA), a leader in the global distribution of used serviceable materials (USM) for all Boeing and Airbus commercial aircraft and associated jet engine platforms, has fully redeemed Turning Rock Partners' (TRP) 2019 preferred equity investment. NLA completed the full redemption of TRP's stake, ahead of schedule, in mid- June 2025.

raw.headline: Next Level Aviation® Completes Recap of Turning Rock Partners
raw.summary: Next Level Aviation® (NLA), a leader in the global distribution of used serviceable materials (USM) for all Boeing and Airbus commercial aircraft and associated jet engine platforms, has fully redeemed Turning Rock Partners' (TRP) 2019 preferred equity investment. NLA completed the full redemption of TRP's stake, ahead of schedule, in mid- June 2025.

headline: TransDigm lowers annual revenue forecast on slowing OEM business
summary: Shares of the company, which makes cockpit security systems and engine sensors for commercial and military jets, fell 8.6% before the bell.  While TransDigm has predominantly benefited from booming demand for repairs on older jets in recent quarters, it also sells OEM parts to Boeing and Airbus.  Both the plane-makers have been grappling with supply chain snags and labor shortages that have sent ripple effects throughout the aerospace industry.

headline: Bain-owned Japanese plane cabin supplier Jamco targets premium seats, acquisitions
summary: SEOUL (Reuters) -Japanese aircraft interiors manufacturer Jamco Corporation is seeking to cash in on a global shortage of new plane seats by reentering the business class seat market under its new owner, Bain Capital, company executives said.  Jamco, which the U.S. private equity firm bought for $700 million this year, also plans to pursue acquisitions globally, chasing premium cabin products for the Airbus and Boeing wide-body airliners the firm supplies.  Aerospace suppliers like Jamco, which mostly makes galley areas and lavatories for twin-aisle planes, have faced parts and labour shortages and cost difficulties as commercial aviation emerged from the pandemic.

raw.headline: Bain-owned Japanese plane cabin supplier Jamco targets premium seats, acquisitions
raw.summary: SEOUL (Reuters) -Japanese aircraft interiors manufacturer Jamco Corporation is seeking to cash in on a global shortage of new plane seats by reentering the business class seat market under its new owner, Bain Capital, company executives said.  Jamco, which the U.S. private equity firm bought for $700 million this year, also plans to pursue acquisitions globally, chasing premium cabin products for the Airbus and Boeing wide-body airliners the firm supplies.  Aerospace suppliers like Jamco, which mostly makes galley areas and lavatories for twin-aisle planes, have faced parts and labour shortages and cost difficulties as commercial aviation emerged from the pandemic.
